alert.note: Alert for Foothills of Northeast Washington; Selkirk Mountains of Northeast Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 03 at 5:58PM PDT until September 03 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND THE POTENTIAL FOR DRY LIGHTNING... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101), Fire Weather Zone 700 Selkirk Mountains of Northeast Washington (Zone 700) and Fire Weather Zone 701 Foothills of Northeast Washington (Zone 701). * Winds: Southwest 10 to 20 mph with local gusts up to 40 mph. Erratic gusty winds are also possible near thunderstorms. * Timing: Through 9pm this evening. * Relative Humidities: 20 to 40 percent. * Impacts: Lightning today could initiate new fires. Gusty winds could cause current fires to spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of Northeast Washington; Selkirk Mountains of Northeast Washington
